Back to our normal days before the COVID-19 started to spread, we used to go to school every weekday of the school year. Going to school, we rode using different types of vehicles like bicycle, car, motorcycle, or tricycle. Kids, what vehicle do you usually use for transportation? Wow! You must have enjoyed you travel then. In this situation, Dave uses a car going to school. Now, can you help me find out the speed of Dave’s car?

Problem: Dave drives an average speed of 54 kph. How many kilometers can he travel in 2 2/6 hours?

Understand:

Asked: distance travel/number of km travel

Given: 54 kph, 2 2/6 hours

Plan:Operation: multiplication

Solve:

54 x 2 2/6 = 54 x 14/6 = 54 x 14/6= 126 km

Answer: Dave can travel 126 km.

Check:

126 ÷ 54 = 2 18/54 or 2 2/6
